qas.question: What two countries were East Prussia partitioned into after World Was II?
What was the city of Konigsberg renamed in to in 1946?
What happened to most of the German population during the war in what is current day Kaliningrad?
In what year did the Potsdam Conference occur?
In what country was Kaliningrad in 1946?
In what year did World War II start?
What was one of the countries that defeated Nazi Germany?
To what country were the German population expelled?

context: Following Nazi Germany's defeat in World War II in <b3_0>1945<b3_0/>, East Prussia was partitioned between <a0_0>Poland and the <b7_0>Soviet Union<b7_0/><a0_0/> according to the Potsdam Conference. Southern East Prussia was placed under Polish administration, while northern East Prussia was divided between the Soviet republics of Russia (the Kaliningrad Oblast) and <b4_0><b6_0>Lithuania<b6_0/><b4_0/> (the constituent counties of the Klaipėda Region). The city of Königsberg was renamed <a1_0>Kaliningrad<a1_0/> in 1946. The German population of the province largely <a2_0>evacuated during the war<a2_0/>, but several hundreds of thousands died during the years <b5_0>1944<b5_0/>–46 and the remainder were subsequently expelled.
